@PadraigMcKeon @offtheball @ChampionsCup So do I 😜

@PadraigMcKeon @offtheball @ChampionsCup Agreed. They all lack authenticity by being as symmetrical as they are in their rulings. Johnny Sexton missed a few games in the pool stages when Ross Byrne played a big part but. Tadhg F has had a quiet season in blue. The marquee names often get rewarded e.g. Richie McCaw

@offtheball Ridiculous with final to go & after QF & SF that Leavy & Ryan don’t have a chance to get a look in on @ChampionsCup Player of the Year because the shortlist is announced so early (January). Also silly that it is so rigged towards finalists & winners #lackscrediblity

@offtheball @UlsterRugby shouldn’t be playing rugby & news media off each other but news media @ game-related press conferences this long after the news event is over is unreasonable. News media can avail of every other hour of any other day to put their questions to @UlsterRugby

@whiskycast Hope you are having a good trip Mark. Bow Street is a lovely place to spend time dramming in.
#Whiskey #Whisky #Ireland #Irish #IrelandsAncientEast https://t.co/ON6mH2nm1v
3 minute read and it gets to the nub of the issue. Stay tuned #Ireland #Healthcare #GP https://t.co/j85Hk3vtmN
@deNudge How can the FATHER NOT have a role? NO VETO just VOLUNTARILY included by the mother in the discussion about HIS BABY…before THE MOTHER DECIDES. #Simples

@cowandspoon @MaeveyBurke @BigDunc123 I am not calling for the legislation to include consultation with the father. I am commenting on how the tone & context around the core issue is airbrushing fathers out. Secondly it does not require any magic to reflect the father’s role in the discussion we are having. #Subtle
@TSMCSports @AllBlacks Campese
@TSMCSports @rupscaucau Danie Gerber over Umaga or Horan
@PamelaMCurtis @hughpmullen @Gordonwdarcy @Together4yes @AndyLeeBoxing @RichieSadlier @kevinmcgahern @ConMurphySport #RespectEveryoneWhenVoting

@PamelaMCurtis @hughpmullen @Gordonwdarcy @Together4yes @AndyLeeBoxing @RichieSadlier @kevinmcgahern @ConMurphySport Yes of course your bodies your choice but they are our babies too so our input shouldn’t be just physical. Consult before you decide please.

@TimesRugby You can try argue it’s not a vintage @ChampionsCup year (while hailing Scarlets) but you can’t discount who Leinster have beaten so far - Champions of Europe & England & Pro14 & the Top14 & Pro14 leaders this year. #Excuses
@TimesRugby Saracens ravaged by injury? Who were they missing, bar Billy Vunipola, when Leinster beat them in the QF? Leinster were missing Sean O’Brien & Robbie Henshaw & Josh Van Der Flier

@lisasaputo @EmmaQuinlan @kevinmcgahern “Big boys pants”? The veil is slipping. Well now you have a problem because, until men are denied the vote, the campaign HAS to be inclusive and speak to everyone who is registered to vote.

@lisasaputo @EmmaQuinlan @kevinmcgahern No, not me. It's up to you and the Yes campaign to change how you/they are addressing father's and men in the messaging of this campaign. It is not rocket science. An inclusive, respectful tone is all. It is not the main issue, yet we are an important constituency just the same.

@lisasaputo @EmmaQuinlan @kevinmcgahern Please just make a little room for the other half of and co-creators of the human race in the margins of the debate - every other angle is covered off. It doesn't threaten the campaign, it just doesn't talk AT men most of whom care and are with you.
@lisasaputo @Gordonwdarcy @Together4yes @AndyLeeBoxing @RichieSadlier @kevinmcgahern @ConMurphySport I have said it, exactly, several times already Lisa. Got to go. Bye

@EmmaQuinlan @lisasaputo @kevinmcgahern I presume you mean they aren't involved after conception? They would be a small minority of pregnancies. I know couples normally talk it out but the YES campaign presents it as a male-free environment. I am simply saying, please consult Dads wherever possible - but Mums decide.

@lisasaputo @Gordonwdarcy @Together4yes @AndyLeeBoxing @RichieSadlier @kevinmcgahern @ConMurphySport It's simple really, you either accept the father exists or you don't. We all agree the woman decides if she has sex (he should also agree by the way), decides if she consults the father & if she decides to termnate their pregnancy. Its just a little courtesy to the other parent.

@lisasaputo @Gordonwdarcy @Together4yes @AndyLeeBoxing @RichieSadlier @kevinmcgahern @ConMurphySport You seem to want men to perfom biologically & democratically to order & then get out of the way. Well humanity doesn't work like that. It would be termed 'use & abuse' if the boot was on the other foot. I am for Repeal in principle, I have yet to see what Oireachtas has to offer

@lisasaputo @Gordonwdarcy @Together4yes @AndyLeeBoxing @RichieSadlier @kevinmcgahern @ConMurphySport Again, NO you misrepresent me. Of course consulting the father is the woman's choice. I am expressing a preference for the dynamic that might exist between the parents re abortion. Is that OK? Am I allowed that much or is my role here to just vote as told & supply seed on demand?
@hughpmullen @Gordonwdarcy @Together4yes @AndyLeeBoxing @RichieSadlier @kevinmcgahern @ConMurphySport Exactly Hugh, a compulsory, voluntary conversation! ;-)
#Respect #Rispetto #ChampionsLeague #LiverpoolRoma https://t.co/MJyz5xLnyA
RT @hansmollman: “I LOVE THIS WOMAN AND HER CURVY BODY. AS A TEENAGER, I WAS OFTEN TEASED BY MY FRIENDS FOR MY ATTRACTION TO GIRLS ON THE T…

@hughpmullen @Gordonwdarcy @Together4yes @AndyLeeBoxing @RichieSadlier @kevinmcgahern @ConMurphySport “How would it work?” Another trick question surely?! Of course the father has no/would never have any legal power of any sort over the mother! All I am advocating is men be part of the VOLUNTARY conversation about a termination. You seem happy that we be used for our seed & vote
You couldn’t make this up! https://t.co/gMhekxs0EQ

@hughpmullen @Gordonwdarcy @Together4yes @AndyLeeBoxing @RichieSadlier @kevinmcgahern @ConMurphySport As I said Hugh, like you I believe the mother decides. I am calling for the role of the father to be included in the discusssion before the mother decides. All I see is language that excludes/ignores them as if all pregnancies were conceived via AI and anonymous donors.

@lisasaputo @Gordonwdarcy @Together4yes @AndyLeeBoxing @RichieSadlier @kevinmcgahern @ConMurphySport No. That is not close to what I am saying. You misrepresent me. The message from the repeal campaign is ALL about the woman’s choice as if the conception was as a result of AI via anonymous donors. It very rarely is. There is no mention of women consulting fathers…there is now.

@lisasaputo @Gordonwdarcy @Together4yes @AndyLeeBoxing @RichieSadlier @kevinmcgahern @ConMurphySport I am half way with you on that. But do not accept that men are simply to be told what is happening to a pregnancy they are vested in. They should be consulted (two way communication) but the woman’s decision is final.

@hughpmullen @Gordonwdarcy @Together4yes @AndyLeeBoxing @RichieSadlier @kevinmcgahern @ConMurphySport “How can the father have any role?”…is that a trick question Hugh or are you just intent on ignoring the obvious that by virtue of impregnating someone you have, er, created a role for yourself? #toolatetopulloutnow 🙄

@hughpmullen @Gordonwdarcy @Together4yes @AndyLeeBoxing @RichieSadlier @kevinmcgahern @ConMurphySport Consulted Shane. Like when someone wants your opinion as a stakeholder which you are when you impregnate someone & half of the DNA of the baby is yours. Your thinking is of the Stone Age wham-bam-couldn’t-be-arsed-thanking-you-Mam/whoever-you-are/were variety

@Gordonwdarcy @Together4yes @AndyLeeBoxing @RichieSadlier @kevinmcgahern @ConMurphySport I agree with the core sentiment of ur tweet but what role do u think the father's of the pregnancy have? Rape aside, I think they should be consulted about ending a pregnancy & should play their part in supporting the decision as much as is possible & appropriate to the situation

@BigDunc123 I agree that the mother should be the primary decision maker but it is also a man's business if he is the father of the pregnancy (other than a rapist). He should be asked his view and support the mother as much as possible.

@JackoRugby Shorlist is made too early in the season. James Ryan and Dan Leavy arguablr better than Sexton and Furlong across the whole competition. Donncha Ryan less flashy but as important as Nakarawa.
RT @des_berry: Breaking! Isa and Richardt leave https://t.co/EbskYIDFgt

@ChampionsCup @TurkishAirlines @chrisjonesrugby @BrianODriscoll @SBarnesRugby Flawed process devaluing overall competition in my opinion with shortlist produced too early in the season. James Ryan & Dan Leavy should be in the hunt for their QF & SF appearances alone, allied to earlier rounds. #Rugby @Leinster

@brianmoore666 @offtheball Genuine observation. Bar ‘07, over the Champions Cup 22 yrs, Top14 (16 finals/8 wins) & Irish systems (6/8) have been more productive in producing 2 or more clubs competing @ semi & final stage. Premiership (8/12) mainly produces just 1 strong team p.a.

@EamonDelaney10 a propos your Times ‘apologia’ for Bertie. Such were his misdemeanors in mismanaging both his own & the public finances, I think we should vigorously resist his attempts at rehabilitation in public life. Doubly so as he has designs on the Aras. Bravo Tim Sebastian

@offtheball @BrianODriscoll The trend of Leinster players bolstering other provinces makes sense at 1 level, but do you agree all 4 clubs are tribal & it could affect ticket sales/ weaken the bond with supporters over time. Especially Uls & Mun. The other academies need 2 deliver

@GifsRugbyNStuff @BHHooker Captainz Cryptic…am I to deduce that you are pointing BHH’s selection of ROL over AB as the answer to my Q? If so it suggests BHH sees ROL’s floor as better than AB’s and his ceiling closer to AB’s which is higher? #toomuchworkforthisluddite
@BHHooker @GifsRugbyNStuff Are you going to give us your opinion?
@GifsRugbyNStuff @BHHooker Ringer to 12 & ROL to 13 makes 🗡🗡🗡🗡🗡🗡🗡🗡🗡 #justsaying
@GifsRugbyNStuff @BHHooker Only 8 Swordsmen in that selection…what did ROL ever do to you?
@GTRees1992 Yeah Leinster were very lucky. Fluked it
@offtheball the guy giving about the ratings ignores 3 or 4 ‘7s’ for Leinster and didn’t even watch the game?! 🙄

@ChampionsCup @WorldRugby @BrianODriscoll @offtheball Why do referees & ARs not enforce: last foot at rucks regularly; side entry has disappeared; players sealing off is rampant; players sledging? - (Nyanga roared into the back of Stander’s head after a penalty decision) #rugby

@ChampionsCup @BrianODriscoll @offtheball I think JP Doyle overcompensated for being Irish today. He allowed Racing away with murder in how they lay around the ball in the tackle & ruck and should have issued yellows in 1st half. Collapsed scrums were ignored
@ChampionsCup @BrianODriscoll McFadden was injured, and had to leave the pitch, by a stray knee from a failed Scarlets tackle. No sanction. Why?

@petersuntimes @OvalDigest As has been asked, what happens if Sexto gets a long term injury or retires in the next 12 months? Are we expected to move Frawley up the food chain and forego having Joey play for his home province?

@offtheball really surprised at @BrianODriscoll picks for Leinster back 3 versus Scarlets. The lack of pace between Ferg, Isa & Rob would really worry me.

@travelgenio It is almost 24 hours since my query to you about what you will do if your passenger misses his connection (which he wants to make)due to lack of time. We are trying to decide what to do. #Heathrow #Gatwick @AerLingus @WestJet #Dublin @beuc @CCPCIreland

@travelgenio I replied by email 3 hours ago but you have not answered. You say the airline “guarantees” the connection & is responsible for offering an alternative due to a “delay on the part of the airline” but you do not say they must offer an alternative if what you/they sell is impossible

@travelgenio I replied by email 3 hours ago but you have not answered. You say the airline “guarantees” the connection & is responsible for offering an alternative due to a “delay on the part of the airline” but you do not say they must offer an alternative if what you/they sell is impossible

@travelgenio @CCPCIreland @AerLingus @aviationreg @eoghancorry I replied by email 3 hours ago but you have not answered. You say the airline “guarantees” the connection & is responsible for offering an alternative due to a “delay on the part of the airline” but you do not say they must offer an alternative if what you/they sell is impossible

@travelgenio What is your responsibility to your customer if he cannot make the connection sold to him by you because you didn’t build in enough time? @CCPCIreland @AerLingus @aviationreg @eoghancorry

@travelgenio What you showed was a faulty flight package that you missold to a young consumer. In another environment it would be called #FakeNews or #FakeFlights If you offer something it has to have a very high 98%+ probability of success @CCPCIreland @aviationreg @conor_pope @AerLingus

@travelgenio What you showed was a faulty flight package that you missold to a young consumer. In another environment it would be called #FakeNews or #FakeFlights If you offer something it has to have a very high 98%+ probability of success @CCPCIreland @aviationreg @conor_pope @AerLingus

@travelgenio What you showed was a faulty flight package that you missold to a young consumer. In another environment it would be called #FakeNews or #FakeFlights If you offer something it has to have a very high 98%+ probability of success @CCPCIreland @aviationreg @conor_pope @AerLingus

@travelgenio You know I follow & reply but I will not be forced to pay more money because of your negligence which @aerlingus is a party to. I even offered to buy a separate ticket to Gatwick & not use the DUB-HRW flight but you threatened to cancel the flight to Vancouver if he did that

@travelgenio You know I follow & reply but I will not be forced to pay more money because of your negligence which @aerlingus is a party to. I even offered to buy a separate ticket to Gatwick & not use the DUB-HRW flight but you threatened to cancel the flight to Vancouver if he did that

@travelgenio @aviationreg @CCPCIreland @beuc @AerLingus @WestJet Consumers depends on the travel agent & the airlines to only offer flight connections that have a very high chance of the passenger being able to make. You with @aerlingus offered a package that has a high chance of failure due to regular travel delays & no fault of the passenger

@travelgenio @aviationreg @CCPCIreland @beuc @AerLingus @WestJet This is a false tweet. I reply to all your mails which just look for more money from the passenger to correct the problem you created with @aerlingus by offering connecting flights that the passenger has a good chance of missing because they are too close together

@travelgenio This is a false tweet. I reply to all your mails which just look for more money from the passenger to correct the error you created with @aerlingus by offering connecting flights that the passenger has a good chance of missing because they are too close together

@aviationreg Shouldn't there be regulations on misselling of flight packages where the agent/airline, as the travel experts, offer consumers flights with inadequate connection times or times that run a high risk of failing if there is any reasonable delay in the travel process?

@aviationreg @CCPCIreland @beuc Both @travelgenio & @AerLingus are blaming a 20 yr old for having just 1hr 50m to get 38 miles from LHR 2 GTW incl. baggage/security & looking to charge him €200/€300 on top of €467 of his cash. They are the experts who missold #Canada #Ireland

@aviationreg @CCPCIreland @beuc Whose is responsible if 2nd flight is missed due to insufficient transfer time tween Heathrow & Gatwick. Agent @travelgenio missold ticket via @AerLingus booking system for 2 flights to Vancouver with @WestJet the 2nd carrier? 1/2 #Canada #Ireland
@CCPCIreland Thank you. Regrettably there is no section to deal with misselling of connecting flights with inadequate transfer times

@CCPCIreland Thank you. It is not your bailiwick. An Argentinian company, operating in EU under Spanish law, miss-selling flights that are too close together and only theoretically achievable. 2 hours 50mins from touchdown in Heathrow to take-off 38 miles away in Gatwick with baggage etc
